bibl.title: Letter from Frederick F. Russell to Laura Armistead Carter, August 27, 1928

div1.p: Russell suggests that working long hours in the Washington, D.C. heat might not be good for Carter's health.

div1.head: Letter from Frederick F. Russell to Laura Armistead Carter, August 27, 1928
div1.opener:

WICKLIFFE ROSE
WILLIAM ALLEN WHITE
August 27, 1928.
My dear Miss Carter:
div1.p:
I beg to acknowledge receipt of your note of the 25th
of August.

I am glad to know that the work is getting along so well.
Until the hot weather is over, however, would it not be wiser for
you to “let up” a little in your work? You cannot afford to run
the risk of being ill again.
div1.closer:
Yours very sincerely, F F Russell Miss Laura A. Carter
2122 California St., N.W.
Washington, D.C.
